channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: 'England is the Super League of Europe' - how Premier League is dominating elite
item.description: English clubs appear to be bossing things in Europe as, for the second time in this season's Champions League, five sides from the Premier League won in a single round of fixtures.

item.title: Earps reaction 'shows pressure on women to be perfect angels'
item.description: In her latest column, Anita Asante looks at how we react to role models not conforming in women's football and the fallout from Mary Earps' book.

item.title: Burn scores brilliant header to give Newcastle lead
item.description: Dan Burn scores a brilliant curling header from a set piece to give Newcastle United an early lead against Athletic Club.

item.title: 'Brilliant finish' - Foden puts Man City ahead against Dortmund
item.description: Phil Foden scores a "brilliant" goal to put Manchester City in the lead against Borussia Dortmund in the Champions League at the Etihad Stadium.

item.title: Ferguson included in Republic of Ireland squad
item.description: Striker Evan Ferguson is included in the Republic of Ireland squad despite struggling with an ankle problem.

item.title: Pochettino on 'missing' Premier League and USA's cultural reset
item.description: Former Tottenham manager Mauricio Pochettino says he is "missing" the Premier League and would like to return in the future.

item.title: Garnacho rescues point for Chelsea against Qarabag
item.description: Chelsea's Alejandro Garnacho ends his European goal drought with an important equaliser as they draw 2-2 with a spirited Qarabag side in the Champions League.

item.title: 'Like a young Messi' - Yamal scores 'sensational' goal for Barcelona
item.description: Teenager Lamine Yamal scores a "sensational" goal in a "moment of pure individual brilliance" for Barcelona against Club Brugge in the Champions League.

item.title: Burn and Joelinton head Newcastle to win over Athletic Club
item.description: Newcastle United beat Athletic Club 2-0 with a pair of headers from Dan Burn and Joelinton.

item.title: Guardiola praises Foden after Man City win
item.description: Manager Pep Guardiola likes what he sees from his Manchester City side as they beat Borussia Dortmund 4-1 in the Champions League with Phil Foden scoring two goals.

item.title: 'I used to stage fights' - Man City confessions
item.description: Manchester City players including Khadija 'Bunny' Shaw and Lauren Hemp share their confessions including things they got away with growing up, mid-game thoughts and what football rule they would change.

item.title: 'Everyone knows his quality' - does Foden deserve England recall?
item.description: Phil Foden will have a close eye on Friday's England squad announcement following his fine form for Manchester City this season, including a double against Borussia Dortmund in the Champions League.

item.title: Eighty-five changes in 16 games - is Chelsea system working after draw?
item.description: The Blues narrowly avoided a historically embarrassing defeat in a 2-2 draw at Qarabag where manager Enzo Maresca's rotation was questioned.

item.title: 'Caught in a trap' - Newcastle now need to end away-day blues
item.description: Newcastle United recorded a fifth consecutive home win against Athletic Club but Eddie Howe knows his side need to solve their away-day woes.

item.title: Fan ban 'incredibly sad' - Maccabi Tel Aviv chief
item.description: Maccabi Tel Aviv chief executive Jack Angelides calls for a separation between football and politics after away fans were banned from Thursday's Europa League game at Aston Villa.

item.title: Cardiff youngsters a 'dream' for Wales boss Bellamy
item.description: Wales head coach Craig Bellamy says Cardiff City's young squad, including Rubin Colwill, is benefiting the Wales national team.

item.title: Foden nets twice to help Man City thrash Dortmund
item.description: Watch highlights as Phil Foden scores two brilliant goals to help Manchester City beat Borussia Dortmund in the Champions League at the Etihad.

item.title: 'Absolutely magnificent' - Watch all the angles of Van de Ven's solo wonder goal
item.description: Watch all the angles of Micky Van de Ven's solo wonder goal for Tottenham in their 4-0 win against Copenhagen in the Champions League.

item.title: Yamal stars as Barcelona draw in thriller with Brugge
item.description: Lamine Yamal scores a brilliant goal to help Barcelona come back from behind three time to finish level with Club Brugge.

item.title: Liverpool beat Real Madrid despite Courtois heroics
item.description: An Alexis MacAllister header gives Liverpool a well-deserved win against Real Madrid who had Thibuat Courtois to thank for keeping the score down to 1-0 in the Champions League at Anfield.

item.title: Arsenal thrash Slavia Prague to match club record
item.description: Watch highlights as Mikel Merino nets twice to help Arsenal get a comfortable win over Slavia Prague in the Champions League and match a 122-year club record of an eight consecutive clean sheets.

item.title: Van de Ven scores brilliant goal as Spurs thrash Copenhagen
item.description: Micky Van de Ven scores as incredible solo goal to help Tottenham Hotspur thrash Copenhagen 4-0, despite being reduced to 10 players, in the Champions League.

item.title: Osimhen hat-trick hands Ajax fourth Champions League defeat
item.description: Victor Osimhen scores a header and two penalties to complete a hat-trick as Galatasaray win 3-0 and condemn Ajax to their fourth successive Champions League defeat.

item.title: How Liverpool's Bradley nullified Vinicius Junior
item.description: Gabby Logan and Stephen Warnock analyse Conor Bradley's impressive performance against Real Madrid and how the Liverpool defender nullified Vinicius Junior.

item.title: The Premier League is the best in the world - Pochettino
item.description: Former Tottenham manager Mauricio Pochettino tells BBC Sport that he is "missing" the Premier League and would like to return in the future.

item.title: Diaz scores twice and gets sent off as Bayern stun PSG
item.description: Luis Diaz nets twice before being sent off as Bayern Munich beat last season's champions Paris Saint-Germain at Parc des Princes.

item.title: Captain Joao Pedro over Haaland - FPL team of the week
item.description: With Chelsea facing managerless Wolves at home this week, it's a chance for FPL managers to captain someone other than Erling Haaland.

item.title: Being Premier League's only black manager 'a privilege' - Nuno
item.description: The West Ham boss says he is "honoured" to act as a role model and believes there are "a lot" of talented black coaches who can follow in his footsteps.

item.title: Marinakis on trial in Athens over inciting gang violence
item.description: Nottingham Forest owner Evangelos Marinakis goes on trial in Athens accused of instigating football violence and supporting a criminal organisation.

item.title: Real Madrid out of Guehi race - Thursday's gossip
item.description: Real Madrid leave Liverpool and Bayern Munich to fight it out over Marc Guehi, Tottenham eye Bundesliga defender, and Barcelona hit Rashford snag.

item.title: Chelsea say players racially abused in academy game
item.description: Chelsea say their academy players were racially abused during a 5-0 win against Qarabag in Baku in the Uefa Youth League.

item.title: Gallagher on target as Atletico Madrid ease to win over Union SG
item.description: Conor Gallagher is among the scorers as Atletico Madrid beat Union Saint-Gilloise 3-1 in the Champions League.

item.title: Monaco get first Champions League win of season against 10-player Bodo/Glimt
item.description: Watch highlights as Folarin Balogun's first Champions League goal helps earn Monaco their first win of this season's league phase against 10-player Bodo/Glimt.

item.title: PSV score late to deny Olympiacos first Champions League win of season
item.description: Substitute Ricardo Pepi scores in stoppage time to earn PSV a point and deny Olympiacos their first win in this season's Champions League at Stadio Georgios Karaiskaki.

item.title: Juventus winless run continues with draw against Sporting
item.description: Juventus fail to get their first Champions League win of the season as they are held to a 1-1 draw by Sporting CP in Turin.

item.title: Napoli suffer back-to-back blanks after dull draw with Eintracht Frankfrurt
item.description: Seria A champions Napoli fail to score for a second match in a row after a lifeless draw against Eintracht Frankfurt in the Champions League at Stadio Diego Armando Maradona.

item.title: Northern Ireland captain Magill announces pregnancy
item.description: Northern Ireland captain and Birmingham City striker Simone Magill announces she is pregnant and will sit out the rest of the season.

item.title: San Siro to be demolished - can Milan clubs compete with Premier League?
item.description: The two Milan football clubs announce plans to demolish San Siro and build a new stadium - but they can they claw the back the gap with English clubs?

item.title: 'If a player was recommended, I always watched them twice away from home'
item.description: In his BBC Sport column, Tony Pulis looks at the increase in data in recruitment, sports science and medicine in football and examines whether it helps managers or not.

item.title: Palace ask for Leeds game to be moved in fixture pile-up
item.description: Manager Oliver Glasner says Crystal Palace have asked the Premier League to rearrange their meeting with Leeds on 21 December to avoid playing twice in three days.

item.title: No away fans, protests and 700 police - Aston Villa v Maccabi Tel Aviv explained
item.description: There will be a huge police presence when Aston Villa face Maccabi Tel-Aviv, but what's the issue and what might happen?

item.title: Isak in but no Gyokeres in Potter's Sweden squad
item.description: Arsenal striker Viktor Gyokeres is not named in Graham Potter's first Sweden squad, but Liverpool's Alexander Isak is included.

item.title: Davies back to lead Wales for crucial qualifiers
item.description: Ben Davies returns for Wales' final World Cup qualifying games against Liechtenstein and North Macedonia but Aaron Ramsey remains out.

item.title: Longer international break 'bit unfair' on smaller nations - O'Neill
item.description: Northern Ireland manager Michael O'Neill believes changes to the international calendar are making it "more challenging" for smaller nations to succeed.

item.title: Who do fans think is the key player in each Premier League team?
item.description: From the "soul of the team" to an "absolute warrior", here are the Premier League's 20 key players, as chosen by our fan writers.

item.title: Identity, belonging, defiantly local - inside Athletic Club's success
item.description: BBC Sport examines how Athletic Club continue to be one of Spain's most successful teams despite their unique selection policy.

item.title: The Â£22m squad out to shock Chelsea - how Qarabag are defying odds
item.description: Azerbaijani team Qarabag host Chelsea on Wednesday bidding to win back-to-back home European matches for the first time. BBC Sport looks at their rise.

item.title: 'Signing of season' - how Xhaka has led Sunderland to top four
item.description: Sunderland captain Granit Xhaka was called the signing of the season - and then came his biggest contribution so far with his strike against Everton.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Who are the youngest Champions League players?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at the youngest players have ever played in the Champions League

item.title: What is a ghostwriter after Earps' book backlash?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at what it means when a book is ghostwritten.

item.title: Where are England's U17 World Cup winners now?
item.description: Ever wondered what happened to England's U17 World Cup-winning side from 2017? BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains...

item.title: What are the Premier League concussion rules?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything Team look at what the Premier League's rules are on head injuries and concussion.

item.title: Why are teams making substitutions in the first minute of matches?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why clubs in the National League Cup are making substitutions in the first minute of games

item.title: Is masked Premier League star allowed to play in Baller League?
item.description: BBC Sport explains the Premier League rules on whether a Premier League player can really feature in Baller League UK.

item.title: What is the Fifpro World XI and who are the winners?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain what the Fifpro World XI is, who votes for the award and when the winners will be announced.

item.title: How are team who edged out Hibs leading Europa League table?
item.description: Despite a change in manager this season, Danes Midtjylland are in a strong position domestically and in the Europa League as they prepare to face Celtic.

item.title: Why Roma will offer Rangers toughest test of season
item.description: Roma are in the mix at the top end of Serie A but visit Ibrox after two home defeats in the Europa League.

item.title: Why Palace conquerors Larnaca should worry Aberdeen
item.description: After defeating Crystal Palace and thrashing AZ Alkmaar in the Conference League, AEK Larnaca will pose a serious threat to Aberdeen. BBC Sport Scotland analyses the Cypriot side.

item.title: Juarez suggested in Celtic manager search - gossip
item.description: Mexican boss of Pumas latest name linked with Celtic as Rangers are said to be consider loaning out their big summer signing...

item.title: Trusty decision 'difficult to understand' - Rohl
item.description: Rangers head coach Danny Rohl says it is "difficult to understand" why Celtic's Auston Trusty was not sent off in the Premier Sports Cup semi-final on Sunday as a kick in the head is always "dangerous" and could lead to injury.

item.title: Celtic job 'not on my radar' - Wales boss Bellamy
item.description: Craig Bellamy understands why he has been linked with the vacant managerial role at his ex-club but is "fully committed" to Wales.

item.title: Juventus appoint former Italy manager Spalletti
item.description: Juventus appoint former Italy head coach Luciano Spalletti as their manager until the end of the season.

item.title: Vinicius Jr no longer feels 'untouchable' - so what's going on?
item.description: Vinicius Jr no longer feels untouchable at Real Madrid and recent events are a truce, not a resolution, writes Guillem Balague.

item.title: PSG's Doue out 'for a few weeks' with thigh injury
item.description: Forward Desire Doue has injured his right thigh and will be "unavailable for a few weeks", Paris St-Germain confirm.

item.title: Real seek 'substantial damages' over Super League ruling
item.description: Real Madrid will seek "substantial damages" from Uefa after European football's governing body lost a court appeal over the failed European Super League.

item.title: Man dies after wheelchair collides with car driven by Inter keeper
item.description: A man dies after his electric wheelchair collides with a car driven by Inter Milan goalkeeper Josep Martinez.

item.title: Pedri hamstring tear adds to Barcelona injury woes
item.description: Barcelona and Spain midfielder Pedri will be sidelined for the foreseeable future after suffering a tear in his hamstring.

item.title: England drawn with Spain in World Cup qualifying
item.description: England are drawn with Spain in their qualifying group for the 2027 Women's World Cup as Scotland, Wales, Northern Ireland and Republic of Ireland all learn their opponents.

item.title: 'Hungry' Scots face Belgium, Israel & Luxembourg
item.description: Melissa Andreatta says Scotland are "hungry" to reach the 2027 Women's World Cup after being drawn to face Belgium, Israel and Luxembourg in qualifying.

item.title: I've not written book to tear anyone down - Earps
item.description: Former England goalkeeper Mary Earps tells BBC Sport she did not write her autobiography to "tear anyone down" and feels reaction to it has been "distorted".

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.

item.title: The rise and fall of North Korea - the sleeping giant of women's football
item.description: North Korea lags behind most of the rest of the world in several areas. But the hermit state has had an outsized impact on international women's football.
